title: Week in pictures: 2 - 8 July 2022
description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken in the past seven days.

title: Italians wait for rain where longest river runs dry
description: Farmers in the north fear for the future as the River Po runs dry in the worst drought in 70 years.

title: Haryana: The 105-year-old 'Bolt granny' breaking running records in India
description: Rambai, who has won over a dozen medals in running competitions, is an inspiration to younger generations.

title: Naomi Campbell on modelling, mortarboards and motherhood
description: The supermodel has been awarded an honorary doctorate by a UK university for her impact on global fashion.

title: The Aids activists who took on big pharma in South Africa
description: The fight for affordable HIV/Aids treatment

title: Political landscape being re-shaped before our eyes
description: With Boris Johnson soon to be an ex-PM, Labour's leader faces a moving target of various possible future ones.

title: Wimbledon: Cameron Norrie says reaching semi-finals is 'pretty sick' after Novak Djokovic loss
description: Britain's Cameron Norrie says reaching the Wimbledon semi-finals is "pretty sick" and gives him added belief he can win a Grand Slam title.

title: The teenagers helping to save - not spend - their parents' money
description: As families are hit by rapidly rising prices, one group of teenagers is taking budgeting lessons home.

title: Shane Richie: Actor to reprise EastEnders Alfie Moon role
description: The much-loved character is set to return for a second time, 20 years after his first appearance.

title: Sailor spots 12ft shark lurking in sea off Tenby
description: Alex Brace spotted the huge beast lurking in the depths off Tenby.

title: What is a vote of no confidence?
description: Keir Starmer is threatening a vote of no confidence in Boris Johnson's government.

title: Boris Johnson resignation: Your questions answered
description: Our political correspondent answers some of your questions on the PM's departure.

title: Shinzo Abe: How the former Japan PM's assassination unfolded
description: How a gunman attacked and fatally shot the former Japanese PM during a campaign rally.

title: Julia James: Callum Wheeler jailed for life for PCSO murder
description: Callum Wheeler attacked the 53-year-old after "ambushing" her in woodland while she walked her dog.

title: Austrian Grand Prix: Max Verstappen sets impressive pace in first practice
description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen sets an impressive pace in first practice at the Austrian Grand Prix.

title: Sir Keir Starmer cleared by police over Durham lockdown beers
description: The Labour leader and his deputy Angela Rayner will not be fined over curry and beer gathering.

title: Jack Wilshere: Ex-Arsenal, West Ham and England midfielder retires
description: Former Arsenal, West Ham and England midfielder Jack Wilshere announces his retirement from football.

title: Wimbledon 2022: Mansour Bahrami's highlights in invitational doubles
description: Watch 68-year-old Mansour Bahrami entertain crowds at Wimbledon with a series of brilliant tricks in the invitational mixed doubles at Wimbledon.

title: Keir Starmer's Durham drink - what were the rules?
description: Police conclude that a gathering involving Keir Starmer did not break Covid rules.

title: Prince Harry wins latest stage in Mail on Sunday High Court libel claim
description: A High Court judge rules that parts of a Mail on Sunday story on the Duke of Sussex were defamatory.

title: Shinzo Abe: Japan ex-leader assassinated while giving speech
description: A man has admitted to shooting the former PM during a campaign event in the city of Nara, police say.

title: Covid infections hit 2.7 million in UK
description: The latest figures show an estimated one in 25 people has the virus.

title: Boris Johnson: Tories vie for leadership as race to replace PM begins
description: Jeremy Hunt is among the Tory MPs considering a bid to be the next Tory leader and prime minister.

title: Kay and Derbyshire to host BBC Breakfast and Newsnight respectively
description: Jon Kay will become a fixture on BBC Breakfast sofa while Victoria Derbyshire will join Kirsty Walk.

title: Cost of living: Energy bills forecast to hit £3,363 a year
description: The prediction comes as a plan is agreed to explore how to help households struggling to pay this winter.

title: Melissa Johns: The disabled actress and the stolen intimate photos
description: Actress Melissa Johns reveals how she reclaimed her body after nude photos of her were leaked.

title: Petrol pricing is cause for concern, warns watchdog
description: The UK's competition body is launching an in-depth study of the market with fuel prices at record highs.

title: Blatter and Platini found not guilty in fraud trial
description: Former Fifa president Sepp Blatter and vice-president Michel Platini have been found not guilty following their fraud trial.

title: Boris Johnson: Fact-checking three years of the outgoing prime minister's claims
description: Some critics of Boris Johnson have questioned his honesty - we tested some of his most notable claims.

title: Boris Johnson's Chequers wedding party moved after criticism
description: Boris Johnson and his wife Carrie had reportedly been planning a wedding party at Chequers in July.

title: PM Kishida's tearful speech after shooting
description: Japan's Prime Minister Fumiuo Kishida speaking before the death of former leader Shinzo Abe.

title: Shinzo Abe death: Shock killing that could change Japan forever
description: The killing of the former PM has raised questions in a country where people don't think about violent crime.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo: Is Manchester United forward's time up at Old Trafford?
description: With Cristiano Ronaldo set to miss Manchester United's pre-season trip abroad, BBC Sport looks at whether the forward is heading out of Old Trafford.

title: Ukraine-Russia: Hidden tech war as Slovyansk battle looms
description: Ukrainian volunteers are taking part in a largely unseen battle to defend their territory with drones.

title: The legacy of Japan's longest serving PM
description: A contentious nationalist, he is known for his signature economic reforms and an assertive foreign policy.

title: James Caan: Hollywood pays tribute to late Godfather actor
description: Al Pacino, Francis Ford Coppola and Robert De Niro lead the tributes to the late Godfather actor.

title: Shinzo Abe: The moment a gunshot is heard
description: Japan's former PM Shinzo Abe has been shot at an event in Japan's western city of Nara.

title: Dinosaur finding hints at why T-rex had small arms
description: Scientists believe tiny limbs gave the giant predator - named Meraxes gigas - survival advantages.

title: Euro 2022: Germany's crown has slipped but can they surprise?
description: Germany are eight-time European champions but they lost in the quarter-finals in 2017 and go into this tournament an unknown quantity.

title: Luton paramedics' out-take video wins social media praise
description: The pair struggle to keep straight faces while filming to mark International Paramedics Day.

title: Gymnast Simone Biles given highest US civilian award
description: The Olympic gymnast is the youngest person ever to receive the Presidential Medal of Freedom.

title: Arachnophobia: Could you conquer your fear?
description: ZSL London Zoo runs a Friendly Spider Programme to help people who have a fear of spiders.
